017package org.microbean.invoke;
018
019import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
020import java.util.Objects;
021import java.util.Optional;
022
023import java.util.function.BiFunction;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027import java.util.function.Supplier;
028
029import java.util.stream.Stream;
030
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
033import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
034
035/**
036 * A {@link Supplier} with additional contractual requirements.
037 *
038 * <p>An {@link OptionalSupplier} does not behave like an {@link
039 * Optional} or a {@link java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture},
040 * despite the deliberate similarities of some methods.</p>
041 *
042 * <p>An implementation of this interface is not a <a
043 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
044 * class</a>.</p>
045 *
046 * @param <T> the type of value implementations of this interface
047 * {@linkplain #get() supply}
048 *
049 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
050 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
051 *
052 * @see #get()
053 *
054 * @see #deterministic()
055 *
056 * @see #optional()
057 */
058@FunctionalInterface
059public interface OptionalSupplier<T> extends Supplier<T> {
060
061  /**
062   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link OptionalSupplier}
063   * is <em>deterministic</em>.
064   *
065   * <p>An {@link OptionalSupplier} is deterministic if and only if:</p>
066   *
067   * <ul>
068   *
069   * <li>Any two invocations of the {@link #get()} method return
070   * objects that are indistinguishable from one another, or</li>
071   *
072   * <li>Any two invocations of the {@link #get()} method throw {@link
073   * RuntimeException}s that are indistinguishable from one
074   * another</li>
075   *
076   * </ul>
077   *
078   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link OptionalSupplier}
079   * is <em>deterministic</em>
080   *
081   * @see #get()
082   */
083  @OverridingEncouraged
084  public default boolean deterministic() {
085    return false;
086  }
087
088  /**
089   * Returns either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
090   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
091   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object)} method on the
092   * supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException} that
093   * does occur.
094   *
095   * @param handler the exception handler; must not be {@code null}
096   *
097   * @return either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
098   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
099   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object)} method on the
100   * supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException} that
101   * does occur
102   *
103   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
104   * null}
105   *
106   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}
107   *
108   * @idempotency This method is not guaranteed to be idempotent or
109   * deterministic.
110   *
111   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
112   * multiple threads, but the {@link #get()} method may not be, and
113   * the {@link Function#apply(Object)} method of the supplied {@code
114   * handler} may not be.
115   */
116  @OverridingDiscouraged
117  public default T exceptionally(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
118    try {
119      return this.get();
120    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
121      return handler.apply(e);
122    }
123  }
124
125  /**
126   * Returns a value, which may be {@code null}, indicating (possibly
127   * transitory) <em>emptiness</em>, or non-{@code null}, indicating
128   * (possibly transitory) <em>presence</em>.
129   *
130   * <p>This method's contract extends {@link Supplier#get()}'s
131   * contract with the following additional requirements:</p>
132   *
133   * <ul>
134   *
135   * <li>An implementation of this method need not be deterministic.</li>
136   *
137   * <li>An implementation of this method may indicate (possibly
138   * transitory) emptiness by any of the following means:
139   *
140   * <ul><li>Returning {@code null}.  The emptiness is
141   * <em>transitory</em>, i.e. a subsequent invocation of this method
142   * may return a non-{@code null} result.</li>
143   *
144   * <li>Throwing a {@link NoSuchElementException}.  The emptiness is
145   * <em>permanent</em>, i.e. all subsequent invocations of this
146   * method will (must) also throw an {@link
147   * NoSuchElementException}.</li>
148   *
149   * <li>Throwing an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.  The
150   * emptiness is <em>permanent</em>, i.e. all subsequent invocations
151   * of this method will (must) also throw an {@link
152   * UnsupportedOperationException}.</li>
153   *
154   * </ul></li>
155   *
156   * <li>The returning of a non-{@code null} value indicates (only)
157   * <em>transitory presence</em>, i.e. a subsequent invocation of
158   * this method may return {@code null} or throw either a {@link
159   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
160   * UnsupportedOperationException}.</li>
161   *
162   * </ul>
163   *
164   * @return a value, or {@code null} to indicate transitory emptiness
165   *
166   * @exception NoSuchElementException to indicate permanent emptiness
167   *
168   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException to indicate permanent
169   * emptiness
170   *
171   * @nullability Implementations of this method may and often will
172   * return {@code null}, indicating transitory emptiness.
173   *
174   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
175   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
176   *
177   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
178   * but need not be deterministic.  However, once an implementation
179   * of this method throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or
180   * an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, it must also do so for
181   * every subsequent invocation.
182   */
183  @Override
184  public T get();
185
186  /**
187   * Invokes the {@link #get()} method and handles either the result
188   * or any {@link RuntimeException}s that are thrown using the
189   * supplied {@link BiFunction}.
190   *
191   * <p>The first argument to the handler will be the return value of
192   * the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code null}.  The second
193   * argument to the handler will be any {@link RuntimeException} that
194   * was thrown during the invocation of the {@link #get()}
195   * method.</p>
196   *
197   * @param <U> the type of the value returned
198   *
199   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
200   *
201   * @return the return value of the supplied {@code handler}'s {@link
202   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object)} method, which may be {@code
203   * null}
204   *
205   * @nullability The default implementation of this method and its
206   * overrides may return {@code null}.
207   *
208   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
209   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
210   *
211   * @idempotency No guarantees about either idempotency or
212   * determinism are made.
213   */
214  @OverridingDiscouraged
215  public default <U> U handle(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
216    try {
217      return handler.apply(this.get(), null);
218    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
219      return handler.apply(null, e);
220    }
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method on the
225   * supplied {@code action} with the return value of an invocation of
226   * the {@link #get()} method, unless the {@link #get()} method
227   * throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
228   * UnsupportedOperationException}, in which case no action is taken.
229   *
230   * @param action the {@link Consumer} representing the action to
231   * take; must not be {@code null}
232   *
233   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} is {@code null}
234   *
235   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
236   * idempotent and deterministic, but the supplied {@link Consumer}
237   * may not be.
238   *
239   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
240   * concurrent use by multiple threads, but the supplied {@link
241   * Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method may not be
242   *
243   * @see #get()
244   */
245  @Convenience
246  @OverridingDiscouraged
247  public default void ifPresent(final Consumer<? super T> action) {
248    try {
249      action.accept(this.get());
250    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
251    }
252  }
253
254  /**
255   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method on the
256   * supplied {@code presentAction} with the return value of an
257   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, unless the {@link
258   * #get()} method throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or
259   * an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, in which case the
260   * {@link Runnable#run()} method of the supplied {@code
261   * absentAction} is invoked instead.
262   *
263   * @param presentAction the {@link Consumer} representing the action
264   * to take if a value is present; must not be {@code null}
265   *
266   * @param absentAction the {@link Runnable} representing the action
267   * to take if a value is absent; must not be {@code null}
268   *
269   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} or {@code
270   * emptyAction} is {@code null}
271   *
272   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
273   * idempotent and deterministic, but the supplied {@link Consumer}
274   * and {@link Runnable} may not be.
275   *
276   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
277   * concurrent use by multiple threads, but the supplied {@link
278   * Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method may not be and
279   * the supplied {@link Runnable}'s {@link Runnable#run()} method may
280   * not be
281   *
282   * @see #get()
283   */
284  @Convenience
285  @OverridingDiscouraged
286  public default void ifPresentOrElse(final Consumer<? super T> presentAction, final Runnable absentAction) {
287    try {
288      presentAction.accept(this.get());
289    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
290      absentAction.run();
291    }
292  }
293
294  /**
295   * Returns a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
296   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
297   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}.
298   *
299   * <p>The default implementation of this method does not and its
300   * overrides must not return {@code null}.</p>
301   *
302   * <p>The default implementation of this method catches all {@link
303   * NoSuchElementException}s and {@link
304   * UnsupportedOperationException}s and returns an empty {@link
305   * Optional} in these cases, which may not be valid for some use
306   * cases.  To detect permanent versus transitory absence, potential
307   * callers should use the {@link #get()} method directly or either
308   * the {@link #optional(Function)} or {@link #optional(BiFunction)}
309   * methods.</p>
310   *
311   * @return a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
312   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
313   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}
314   *
315   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not
316   * and overrides must not return {@code null}.
317   *
318   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is and
319   * overrides must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
320   *
321   * @idempotency The default implementation and overrides of this
322   * method may not be idempotent or deterministic.
323   *
324   * @see #optional(BiFunction)
325   *
326   * @see #get()
327   */
328  @Convenience
329  @OverridingDiscouraged
330  public default Optional<T> optional() {
331    return this.optional(OptionalSupplier::returnNull);
332  }
333
334  /**
335   * Invokes the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method, supplying it with
336   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to the
337   * {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
338   * result.
339   *
340   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Optional}
341   *
342   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
343   *
344   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
345   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
346   * value of invoking the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method with the
347   * supplied {@code handler}
348   *
349   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
350   * null}
351   *
352   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
353   * return {@code null}.
354   *
355   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
356   * idempotent and deterministic.
357   *
358   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
359   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
360   *
361   * @see #handle(BiFunction)
362   *
363   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
364   */
365  @Convenience
366  @OverridingDiscouraged
367  public default <U> Optional<U> optional(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
368    return Optional.ofNullable(this.handle(handler));
369  }
370
371  /**
372   * Invokes the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method, supplying it
373   * with the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to
374   * the {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
375   * result.
376   *
377   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
378   *
379   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
380   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
381   * value of invoking the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method
382   * with the supplied {@code handler}
383   *
384   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
385   * null}
386   *
387   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
388   * return {@code null}.
389   *
390   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
391   * idempotent and deterministic.
392   *
393   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
394   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
395   *
396   * @see #exceptionally(Function)
397   *
398   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
399   */
400  @Convenience
401  @OverridingDiscouraged
402  public default Optional<T> optional(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
403    return Optional.ofNullable(this.exceptionally(handler));
404  }
405
406  /**
407   * Invokes the {@link Optional#orElse(Object)} method on the return
408   * value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the
409   * supplied {@code other}, and returns the result.
410   *
411   * @param other the alternate value; may be {@code null}
412   *
413   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
414   * Optional#orElse(Object)} method on the return value of the {@link
415   * #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
416   * other}
417   *
418   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
419   *
420   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
421   *
422   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
423   * multiple threads, but the {@link Supplier#get()} method of the
424   * supplied {@code supplier} may not be
425   *
426   * @see #optional()
427   *
428   * @see Optional#orElse(Object)
429   */
430  @Convenience
431  @OverridingDiscouraged
432  public default T orElse(final T other) {
433    try {
434      return this.get();
435    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
436      return other;
437    }
438  }
439
440  /**
441   * Invokes the {@link Optional#orElseGet(Supplier)} method on the
442   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with
443   * the supplied {@code supplier}, and returns the result.
444   *
445   * @param supplier the alternate value {@link Supplier}; must not be
446   * {@code null}
447   *
448   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
449   * Optional#orElseGet(Supplier)} method on the return value of the
450   * {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
451   * supplier}
452   *
453   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
454   * null}
455   *
456   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
457   *
458   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
459   *
460   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
461   * multiple threads, but the {@link Supplier#get()} method of the
462   * supplied {@code supplier} may not be
463   *
464   * @see #optional()
465   *
466   * @see Optional#orElseGet(Supplier)
467   */
468  @Convenience
469  @OverridingDiscouraged
470  public default T orElseGet(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
471    try {
472      return this.get();
473    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
474      return supplier.get();
475    }
476  }
477
478  /**
479   * Invokes the {@link #orElseThrow(Supplier)} method with {@link
480   * NoSuchElementException#NoSuchElementException()
481   * NoSuchElementException::new} and returns the result.
482   *
483   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #orElseThrow(Supplier)}
484   * method with {@link
485   * NoSuchElementException#NoSuchElementException()
486   * NoSuchElementException::new}
487   *
488   * @exception NoSuchElementException if the {@link #optional()}
489   * method returns an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link
490   * Optional}
491   *
492   * @nullability This method never returns, and its overrides must
493   * never return, {@code null}.
494   *
495   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be, as
496   * idempotent and deterministic as the {@link #optional()} method.
497   *
498   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
499   * concurrent use by multiple threads
500   *
501   * @see #orElseThrow(Supplier)
502   */
503  @Convenience
504  @OverridingDiscouraged
505  public default T orElseThrow() {
506    try {
507      return this.get();
508    } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException e) {
509      throw new NoSuchElementException(e.getMessage(), e);
510    }
511  }
512
513  /**
514   * Invokes the {@link Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)} method on the
515   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with
516   * the supplied {@code throwableSupplier}, and returns the result.
517   *
518   * @param <X> the type of {@link Throwable} the supplied {@code
519   * throwableSupplier} {@linkplain Supplier#get() supplies}
520   *
521   * @param throwableSupplier the {@link Throwable} {@link Supplier};
522   * must not be {@code null}
523   *
524   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
525   * Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)} method on the return value of the
526   * {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
527   * throwableSupplier}
528   *
529   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
530   * null}
531   *
532   * @exception X (actually {@code <X>}) if the {@link
533   * #optional()} method returns an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty()
534   * empty} {@link Optional} and the {@link
535   * Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)} method throws an exception
536   *
537   * @nullability This method never returns, and its overrides must
538   * never return, {@code null}.
539   *
540   * @idempotency This method is and its overrides must be idempotent
541   * and deterministic.
542   *
543   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its overrides must be,
544   * safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
545   *
546   * @see #optional()
547   *
548   * @see Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)
549   */
550  @Convenience
551  @OverridingDiscouraged
552  public default <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow(final Supplier<? extends X> throwableSupplier) throws X {
553    try {
554      return this.get();
555    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
556      final X throwable = throwableSupplier.get();
557      if (throwable.getCause() == null) {
558        throwable.initCause(e);
559      } else {
560        throwable.addSuppressed(e);
561      }
562      throw throwable;
563    }
564  }
565
566  /**
567   * Invokes the {@link Optional#stream()} method on the return value
568   * of the {@link #optional()} method, and returns the result.
569   *
570   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
571   * Optional#stream()} method on the return value of the
572   * {@link #optional()} method
573   *
574   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
575   * return {@code null}.
576   *
577   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
578   * idempotent and deterministic.
579   *
580   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
581   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
582   *
583   * @see #optional()
584   *
585   * @see Optional#stream()
586   */
587  @Convenience
588  @OverridingDiscouraged
589  public default Stream<T> stream() {
590    try {
591      return Stream.of(this.get());
592    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
593      return Stream.empty();
594    }
595  }
596
597  private static <T> T returnNull(final RuntimeException e) {
598    if (e instanceof NoSuchElementException || e instanceof UnsupportedOperationException) {
599      return null;
600    } else {
601      throw e;
602    }
603  }
604
605}
